Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule

Class Schedule

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule.Schedule
public class Schedule
extends java.lang.Object
The Schedule class is used to store the student's courses The methods all work together to add and remove courses from the student's schedule the setter methods check for invalid inputs the getter methods return the courses and title
Author:
Armando, Kiran, Kennedy

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Schedule()
    The Schedule constructor sets the schedule's title to "My Schedule" an empty ArrayList of Courses is created

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean addCourseToSchedule​(Course c)
    This method adds a course to a student's schedule we first start by checking for null courses we check for duplicates we then check for any conflicts if all checks pass, we add the curse to schedule
    boolean canAdd​(Course c)
    Checks to see if course can be added to schedule
    int getScheduleCredits()
    Totals up credits of all courses
    java.lang.String[][] getScheduledCourses()
    this getter method gets the courses that a student has it has 4 columns, index 0 for name index 1 for section index 2 for title index 3 for meeting string
    java.lang.String getTitle()
    this getter method gets the title of the schedule
    boolean removeCourseFromSchedule​(Course c)
    This method removes a course from a student's schedule
    void resetSchedule()
    This method resets the student's schedule the title is set to "My Schedule" the schedule is set to an empty ArrayList
    void setTitle​(java.lang.String title)
    This setter method checks for a null string input if the String passes the check, it is set as the title for the schedule

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Schedule

      public Schedule()
      The Schedule constructor sets the schedule's title to "My Schedule" an empty ArrayList of Courses is created

  • Method Details

    • addCourseToSchedule

      public boolean addCourseToSchedule​(Course c)
      This method adds a course to a student's schedule we first start by checking for null courses we check for duplicates we then check for any conflicts if all checks pass, we add the curse to schedule
      Parameters:
      c - is the course to be added to a student's schedule
      Returns:
      true if the course was able to be added

    • removeCourseFromSchedule

      public boolean removeCourseFromSchedule​(Course c)
      This method removes a course from a student's schedule
      Parameters:
      c - is the course to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the course was able to be removed

    • resetSchedule

      public void resetSchedule()
      This method resets the student's schedule the title is set to "My Schedule" the schedule is set to an empty ArrayList

    • getScheduledCourses

      public java.lang.String[][] getScheduledCourses()
      this getter method gets the courses that a student has it has 4 columns, index 0 for name index 1 for section index 2 for title index 3 for meeting string
      Returns:
      courses the 2d string array representation of the courses

    • setTitle

      public void setTitle​(java.lang.String title)
      This setter method checks for a null string input if the String passes the check, it is set as the title for the schedule
      Parameters:
      title - is the string title to be passed in
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the title string is null

    • getTitle

      public java.lang.String getTitle()
      this getter method gets the title of the schedule
      Returns:
      title the name of the schedule

    • getScheduleCredits

      public int getScheduleCredits()
      Totals up credits of all courses
      Returns:
      total of all credits in schedule

    • canAdd

      public boolean canAdd​(Course c)
      Checks to see if course can be added to schedule
      Parameters:
      c - course to check
      Returns:
      true if course can be added to schedule
